guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for gefitinib and CYP2D6

literature.title: Dutch Pharmacogenetics Working Group Guidelines August 2019

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

summaryMarkdown.html: There are currently no dosing recommendations for gefitinib based on CYP2D6 genotype.

textMarkdown.html:
November 2018 Guideline

The Royal Dutch Pharmacists Association - Pharmacogenetics Working Group has evaluated therapeutic dose recommendations for gefitinib based on CYP2D6 genotypes. They conclude that NO action is required for this gene-drug interaction.

Wording in table taken from the Dutch guidelines November 2018 update

ALLELE/GENOTYPE/PHENOTYPEDRUGDESCRIPTIONRECOMMENDATION
CYP2D6 PMgefitinibThe gefitinib plasma concentration may increase due to reduced CYP2D6 activity. However, there is no evidence to suggest that side effects increase to an extent that adjustment of therapy is needed.NO action is needed
CYP2D6 IMgefitinibSide effects can occur more frequently, as the gene variation increases the gefitinib plasma concentration. However, the side effects are reversible and manageable, to an extent that adjustment of the therapy in advance is not necessary.NO action is needed
CYP2D6 UMgefitinibThe gene variation may lead to a decrease in the gefitinib plasma concentration. In practice, an alternative is only chosen if non-response to gefitinib has been proved. Moreover, dose adjustments guided by the gefitinib plasma concentration are rarely performed in clinical practice as the analytical method is not available in most hospitals.NO action is needed

Read for more information about this recommendation, Read about gene information from DPWG
